Reviews.Title: “Exceedingly good things can come in small packages”
Reviews.Author: mariposa888
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hop Inn in Hong Kong in October and highly recommend it to anyone planning a short stay in Hong Kong. I was travelling for work and Hop Inn had been recommended by an architect friend who had visited but not stayed in it. The booking was made on my behalf by someone else and proved to be the source of a great joke and prompted questions such as: have you seen where you are going? Do you know how cheap it is? Rumors abounded that I would be sharing a room with other people … The disbelief resulted from the seemingly absurdly cheap price. The reality was… a clean (albeit tiny) room, with en-suite (power shower), 24 hour air conditioning, free WiFi and a fabulous location. Hop Inn is also very easy to find arriving on the airport bus. The very friendly and helpful staff provided much appreciated advice/recommendations on places to eat/visit. Hop Inn, Hong Kong provides high quality service in a very compact package, it is an ideal base for exploring the city, and offers unbelievable value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Kie C
Reviews.Content: Tsim Tsa Tsui (TST), in my opinion, is the most convenient area to stay in Hong Kong and Hop Inn Hankow is less than 5 minutes walk from the MTR. Shopping, dining and attractions are within walking distance. TST MTR station is in a very centralised location that allows you to travel to different parts of Hong Kong easily. The 2 Hop Inn locations are within walking distance so no real difference which one you choose (location wise). I stayed in the Hankow one for 4 nights and on my very first night, walked to Carnavon Road (where the other Hop Inn is located) for supper and back. During my stay, I found the staff to be very friendly, rooms are small but clean. Wifi is available and they have laptop and tablets for lending, all this for free. There is a staff round the clock who will open the main door for you so if you need any help at any time, there is someone there. Maybe the only thing to highlight is that even though there are efforts to sound-insulate the doors, it can't be helped that you may get disturbed if another room have noisy kids or loud guests due to the close proximity of the rooms. Will definitely come back when in Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Overall great cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: richhewett
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hop Inn Hankow for 5 nights. Pros: - Excellent location and very close to TST MTR - Very cheap rates - Fast free wifi internet for downloads - Very friendly and helpful staff - Fast and helpful replies to emails - Very clean and modern - Good sized LCD TV - Nice artwork on the walls in the room Cons: - Relatively slow internet for uploads - Very small room but perfectly functional

Reviews.Title: “Hop Inn on Carnarvon Road”
Reviews.Author: hoondc
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic, access to major malls and MTR is within easy walking distance. Rooms are clean and neat. Service staff are very friendly, always there, even at near midnight hours, i wonder if they ever sleep. Definitely a good choice for a stay. See you again!!

Reviews.Title: “Hop Inn on Carnavon Road”
Reviews.Author: iZUh5
Reviews.Content: Overall a gem in Tsim Sha Tsui, will be back! Service - Always there and ready to assist Value - Room with ensuite bathroom, TV with basic local channels and DVD player (selection of DVDs in the common room) Sleep Quality - Mattress is thin and pillow too small for my liking Cleanliness - Very clean! Location - Less than 2mins walk to Tsim Sha Tsui Exit D2 Rooms - Twin Room, L2. Will be better if hair-dryer is provided in the room instead of having to walk over to the reception to borrow it

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: Michelle B
Reviews.Content: It was the first time my friend and I had visited Hong Kong, and so were a bit cautious when it came to booking accommodation there as we weren't really sure where the "good" and "bad" places to stay were, but we were so glad to have encountered Hop Inn! The staff at both locations were super-helpful, the rooms clean, funky and fun, and the whereabouts couldn't have been better (we ended up cancelling accommodation bookings we'd made in other locations around Hong Kong so we could spend more time at Hop Inn, where we were central, safe, comfortable and welcome). It really put that extra positive spin on our holiday. Now I'm back from Hong Kong I definitely want to return (hopefully some time next year) and look around some more, and when I do, I will definitely stay at Hop Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “We Love HOP INN!”
Reviews.Author: Shianne J
Reviews.Content: It is our first family trip in Hong Kong and Hop Inn didn't gave us a hard time in finding their location. Staff are friendly and very accomodating. They have maps available for the guest and they will gladly help you to find your destination. They also clean the room and change the bed sheets everyday so when you come back to your room from a very tiring day, you can just relax and have a good sleep. What we love the most about Hop Inn is that, their location is very near to MTR station, restaurants, and if you are a shopaholic, Harbour City is just a 5 mins walk. We're planning to go back to HK next year and definitely, Hop Inn will be again our host. Thank you so much, Hop Inn for being a part of our HK trip last July 24 to 28! More power and see you again soon! :) #chardshaikeana, Philippines.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome find in tsim sha tsui!”
Reviews.Author: miracle21
Reviews.Content: I never quite imagined I'd stay in an inn in hongkong...especially not since friends have reported cramp and barely clean conditions in the other more famous hostels around...anyway, hop inn on carnavon road is super close to everything, food galore all over and just a stone's throw away from shopping and the mtr. Warm service...a pity I made a mistake with the booking....booked two twin beds instead of 1 queen's sized bed...the room is expectedly small, shower facilities adequate but could do with a bit more strength! Loved the idea of the see through bath though it tends to get all wet with the showerhead just above the wc and sink. Beds are hard but the pillows are too soft - ended up with neckache after three nights. The curtains were a bit too short hence I was awakened by the bright sunrays...not that that was a huge problem. Walls are thin but it was ok. Complimentary water provided...very cosy place and best of all, value for money! Definitely will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Little Place!”
Reviews.Author: jimbosheff
Reviews.Content: Definitely my place of stay on my next visit. Staff very knowledgeable and helpful. Free top up of filtered water 24 hrs and nice open air rooftop to chat and spend time till late at night. Except for the low water pressure when taking shower, the rest of our stay are excellent

Reviews.Title: “Hop Inn Carnavon”
Reviews.Author: h3hehaha
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hop Inn Carnavon for 4 nights leaving only yesterday. 4 of us in the group thus 2 double rooms L1 and L4 Basically this is no frills no fuss hostel at a reasonable valued price, in a fantastic location. Tsim Sha Tsui exit 2, straight walk down and will see the 7-11 and it just beside it, service was excellent with prompt email response during reservation as well but the average rating is attributed to: Room wise was small as expected no complains, but double bed was certainly not really for 2 but that is fine as well but what i cannot accept was even the pillows was not standard size (i have stayed in smaller hostel but they still gave us standard pillow), the ones provided seems meant for kids, thus sleep quality was non existence. Our neigbours were was also not helping much as they came back late and make all sort of noises, talking loudly and playing music in the middle of the nights but no fault on the hostel then. Lastly there was bugs found on my bed, did not manage to catch it and i did not let the staff know as well but a cockroach was found and killed in my friend room with the staff notify. To conclude, Hop inn is a great value for money hostel provided you get good neigbours and u are happy with sleeping on kids pillows

Reviews.Title: “Good and value every cent spent”
Reviews.Author: danaline
Reviews.Content: Definitely my place of stay on my next visit. Staff very knowledgeable and helpful. Free top up of filtered water 24 hrs and nice open air rooftop to chat and spend time till late at night. Except for the low water pressure when taking shower, the rest of our stay are excellent

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and good”
Reviews.Author: WJAlmighty
Reviews.Content: It was a really great stay at Hop Inn (Carnarvon). My friend and I stayed here for 4 nights and felt really pleased with the services and amenities. We were given a twin bedded room, it was really nice and clean. Towels (one-time use), shampoo and body foam are provided. For the towel, you can request a fresh piece but there's a charge if I'm not wrong. The common area have many dvds for rental. There are also books, newspapers, a table-soccer table and an outdoor area for smokers. Other than that, there is also drinks and chips for sales too. Last but not least, you can refill drinking water from the water dispensers at the other corner of the level. There are many shopping malls, pubs, cafes and snack stores around the area. The location is awesome and nearby MTR station. Also, victoria harbor and avenue of stars is just 10 - 15 mins of walking distance from the MTR station. The hostel fees is affordable and reasonable. For the price of around SGD$220, I stayed 4 nights there. We really enjoyed ourselves during our stay at Hong Kong. It's a great place to rest our feet and replenish ourselves for the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Hop Inn Carnarvon”
Reviews.Author: Tuscanysun
Reviews.Content: We like the staff in Hop Inn as they were very warm, friendly and helpful during our 5 day stay, special thanks goes to Ellen. We are especially thankful that they allow us to change room from one with overwhelming design to one with sweet and adorable goldfishes (P4). They provided directions and advice to the weather conditions and places for food in response to our enquires. The room is very clean and we like the simple yet artistic design of our room (S2). However, the rooms are small and do not have any wardrobe. The multi-function common room serves as a cosy place to bond with friends over dessert and snack. The location of Hop Inn is very convenient to access MTR and the shopping belt of Nathan Road. Overall, some of us had a pleasant stay and will sure stay in Hop Inn in our next visit to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Smart Option in HK (Carnarvon)”
Reviews.Author: losantipodas
Reviews.Content: Impressive experience given the cheap rates, especially when traveling in a group or even when sharing a double. Location is impeccable as you are steps away from the TST MTR connecting to Central (HK Island) and to the rest of Kowloon. TST itself is a very busy commercial area. It's also easy to walk over to the waterfront, where you can catch the Star Ferry and the light-show every evening. The rooms are small but extremely clean and comfortable. There is a nice common room and balcony, which partly makes up for the small rooms. Wi-Fi was free throughout the hotel and the staff were highly attentive to our needs and questions. Stayed at a triple with an extra bed.

Reviews.Title: “Carnarvon Road, Hop Inn”
Reviews.Author: HkJessica_H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on my own and would definitely recommend. Staff extremely helpful and friendly. Very good English. Location is very easy to access all parts of HK and close to the underground. Safe, secure and clean, basic rooms at a good price. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Keepdoinit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hop Inn, Canarvon Rd, Hong Kong because the other one was booked out. It is central to Nathan Rd,downtown HK and the Star Ferry. It's on the ninth floor, there's a large sign at the entrance otherwise you'd miss it. The rooms are themed - we had the goldfish bowl! The bathroom was separate but see through glass, privacy is achieved by a full width shower curtain. The room was very clean, thick white towels and the bathroom kept spotless. There is a common room and a roof area you can access. Fantastic value, we loved it and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “convenient and perfect for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: Shiela C
Reviews.Content: Hop inn Hankow has a very good location, convenient to local restaurants, inexpensive & high-end shops, night markets by train and MTR & bus stations. You can best experience all of these on foot. I took the airport express (train) upon arrival, and took Kowloon station where free shuttle is available. The hotel is just walking distance, 3min from the shuttle drop/pick-up. The room given to me was the sports type room, suitable for one person. The room is small as expected but perfect for me, enough space to hang clothes and lay my small luggage. Bathroom is really small and challenging to move around. Overall, the place was clean, housekeeping is done everyday while I'm out. Wifi connection is fast and free. Reception staff were helpful, available always - since they need to open the door whenever you arrive anytime and speak very good English. If you're fond of chinese food, local restaurants can be found just a few shops away on both sides of the building. Roasted pecking duck in inexpensive and authentic! The only downside of it is that my room was facing the road where even at night it's still difficult to get some sleep even with the curtains closed. Bright lights reflecting the room and noisy even in the middle of the night. So try to get rooms not directly facing the street. Overall, the experience was good , perfect for budget travelling and would again travel to HK and stay at Hop Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value @ Hop Inn”
Reviews.Author: Blain S
Reviews.Content: Great location in TST, close to everything you could want. Clean and well maintianed rooms with very friendly, helpful staff. Great idea having a common room where you can choose a book to read ( if you didn't bring one ) as well as a large selection of movies to watch in your room that they provide for their guests free of charge. Also, a roof-top lounge area to relax in if you're not up to walking around the city without having to stay in your room. The only downside is the beds are a little too hard for my liking. For a person who has reasonably high standards, I would suggest a stay at the Hop Inn for comfort, convience, and resonable prices. Definitely your money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Stay @ Hop Inn Carnavon”
Reviews.Author: Belinda L
Reviews.Content: Very Good Location, Near to TST MTR Station and East TST MTR station. The room that I stayed in is the Goldfish twin bedroom.The size of the bedroom is just nice for both of us with our luggage. Although, the bed are a bit too hard for my taste but I still feel very comfortable with the room The staffs are very friendly and helpful and gave really good recommendations for the food that we wanted to eat.. :) Definitely will come back again and recommend them to all my friends when they go to Hong Kong :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay for a big group (Carnarvon)”
Reviews.Author: thepearlyn
Reviews.Content: The location wasn't hard to find at all, Check in was a breeze for such a big group such as us - 8 people. The no frills rooms were well maintained and clean. The great thing about this place is that it's just one level, making it easy to look for each other, plus there was a game room/ balcony perfect for late night take away supper + midnight games for all of us. There's even a DVD library. Just one complain, it can get really noisy due to the thin walls and don't expect a "langham place" bed. Overall, a more then perfect stay. what more could you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Hop Inn - Carnarvon”
Reviews.Author: AdventureSparrow
Reviews.Content: Another fantastic stay at Hop Inn, this time at the Carnarvon location - which I actually liked better than the other one! The staff were great, we arrived on a very early flight and they had our room ready in no time. They were also very helpful in pointing us to the laundry down the street (which left our clothes smelling amazing...bonus!), printing things for us and generally being helpful and great. The room itself was just fine, used the limited space well and was comfortable and quiet. The location is excellent, so close to everything you could need. We got breakfast at the place a few stores down often and a few days we went to the Delifrance down the street. There's a 7/11 right next door, McDs across the street if that's your thing and the K11 mall is super close too. Very very impressed with how close we were to everything! A great little place in the heart of Kowloon, we'll be back again for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay @ Hop Inn Carnavon”
Reviews.Author: meltwinky
Reviews.Content: Superconvenient location, probably just about 5min walk from the nearest mrt exit and 10min wallk from the A21 bus stop. Lots of amenities just downstairs (food, convenience stores, shopping). Receptionist was friendly and helpful. Free wifi and even allowed us to borrow laptop for use. We had a twin-sharing room with attached bathroom. Overall a simple room, but more spacious than expected, and very clean and tidy. The mattress was a little hard, other than that no complaints. Having said that, we passed by another room (queen bed), even though it's also a room for two, it seems much smaller than ours, so I'm glad we got a twin-sharing instead of a double-room.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive good value in HK”
Reviews.Author: ivyz
Reviews.Content: I didnt stay in Hop Inn, but my friends stayed here for several nights and I spend sometime in one evening playing foosball here. The environment is good, clean and well-designed as a hostel, def. good value of money spent. Staff has excellent service. Their entertainment center has basic things you want, books, dvd, foosball etc. The balcony is very cool. I will stay here next time I came visit HK!

Reviews.Title: “Hop Inn on Carnarvon - great location”
Reviews.Author: upsalala
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room (S1) at the Hop Inn on Carnarvon for three nights end of June 2012. Prior to my arrival, all communication with the hostel was prompt and helpful. They provided me with a very good instructions on how to reach the hostel using a Hotel Airport Express Bus from Kowloon Station. Would have been lost otherwise! The hostel is located on the 9. Floor of an multi-purpose building, that also seems to have a dubious massage studio on level 7. There is a lift. The entrance to the building is a bit shabby but there is a kind of doorman who monitors various security cameras. The building's facade was being renovated at the time, so there was scaffolding and a few workmen out front too. The location is great; close to shops, eateries, public transport, sights & attractions (e.g. Avenue of Stars, Star Ferry Terminal, various markets). It's a vibrant and busy area, and if you do need a bit of peace and quiet, Kowloon Park is just down the road. My room was small, but the available space had been maximised. A flatscreen TV with built-in DVD player and a bed with a tiny bedside table were the only furniture. For clothing, there's a few hooks on the door. Had own bathroom with shower, toilet, basin - again, all small but functional and very modern. The rooms are cleaned daily. There is air-conditioning, though the temperature cannot be regulated individually, which left me having to choose between a rather cool 17 degrees or humid stuffiness. Recommend ear plugs for light sleepers as walls are quite thin. My only gripe is that my room had no window, which made me feel slightly claustrophobic. The communal spaces were great; a common room with games, DVDs, free drinking water and a large balcony/roof-garden. Free WiFi throughout. The décor is modern, minimalist and arty. Each room has a theme and is painted accordingly. Staff were super-friendly and helpful. I'd stay again for the value for money, location and staff, though I'd ask for a room with a view, or at least a window!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for money. Very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Jsfjr1985
Reviews.Content: The reason why I'm booking this hotel on my return to hk is because of its very friendly staff. The room is enough for backpackers and to those who are planning to spend their day outside(why spend money on expensive hotels in hk? ;-)) . The rooms are nice but it had bedbugs when I was there (hopefully, it's not there anymore).

Reviews.Title: “My first trip to Hongkong with Best acomodation ever!”
Reviews.Author: aurelia_12
Reviews.Content: the staff are very friendly, the place are really clean and tidy. i love their concept of the room decor too. It's very near to everywhere : restaurant, cafe, seven eleven, circle K, pub&bar, mall, and also ferry terminal if you wanna cross to macau. one word for this place : PERFECT :) definelity will stay there again if i go to HK !

Reviews.Title: “Worth a stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sanvin08
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Clean and cosy - Different themes room which make it looks vibrant - Very helpful and friendly staffs - Great location within a 7 mins walk from TST MTR station Cons: - Small double bed - Compact lift which fits only ard 5 people - Aircon is slightly block by the curtains This is my first stay in a motel/hostel and it was a marvelous experience. The toilet and room is very clean and refreshing. During this stay i was provided a 'orange rabbit' theme room which i'm very happy about it. This place do not require you to pay any deposit in advance so you will only settle the full payment when you check out. The staffs will clean up and vacuum the room everyday but they do not change your bedsheets and towels daily.If i remember correctly, they do have hair dryers for you to borrow. They also have international travel adapters at a deposit of approximately HKD$10(if i rem correctly) and they will refund this $10 to you when you return. For those who have visited HK before, you should know that the room space is very small so this place is no exception as it can only be occupied by 2 people with 2 small opened hard-cased luggage. Something interesting that i found out is that level 2,3 or 4 might have some 'special' business ongoing as i was shocked one day that a lady from these level wrapped a piece of towel and came in to the lift. I'm not very sure if there are existence of this kind of 'biz' in this building. Do take note that the main gate of this builing will closed around 11 or 12 plus so you need to press a bell at the left hand side of the gate if the security is not there (which they are MIA most of the time). Or maybe you can call Hop Inn number and the staff at level 6 will helped you to unlock the gate. Perhaps you can enquire the staff there about this late night gate thingy as i was not aware of this before i went there. Overall, this place is worth a stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean budget guest house with one problem.”
Reviews.Author: Cecio8
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room at the Hop Inn at Carnarvon Road early May for 10 nights. I travel to Hong Kong every year for about 2 weeks and stayed at different guest houses in Tsim Sha Tsui area, this was my first stay at Hop Inn. Like most reviewers said, the location is perfect, the room and bathroom, although small, is very clean and newly decorated. I got to talk to 3 different reception staff and they were all nice and professional and responsive to my request/enquiry. I had to switch room on day 3 because the wifi was not stable for my first room (need to reboot the router whenever I need to login). Had no problem with wifi after I changed room. I have one complaint and that's a big one for me.... the short supply of hot water in the shower. When the shower was on, hot water disappeared before I could even rinse the shampoo off my hair. They use "storage" water heater in which you turn on the water heater, wait for 15 minutes (the staff said) for the water to heat up in the storage unit and then you can take a shower. At first I thought it was an individual problem in my first room, but when I told the reception staff about it, I was surprised to hear that other guests complained about it and a technician was called to look at the problem (which he couldn't find a problem with the heating process). I am pretty sure it wasn't a malfunction of every unit, but rather the model they picked with a small size water tank that is the key problem. When I switched room, I chatted with a house keeping lady and she agreed it was a common problem. She is the cleaning lady that cleans every room so she should know! I don't want to write a bad review without any proof, and I was staying for 10 nights so I could do a little experiment. I brought my iPhone in the shower with me and used the stop watch to time how long the hot water would last. I also waited 15 mins, 30 mins, 1 hr, 2 hrs, half a day (just various duration) after I turned on the shower because I turned it on to see if that made any difference. The shortest time the hot water "started" getting cold was 52 seconds, and it turned completely cold within 30 seconds after that.... a total of 1 min 22 seconds of hot water. And no, I doubt if anyone can finish a shower within that time frame (washing hair or not). The average time when hot water started to get cold was in the 2-minute range, and usually by the 3rd minutes hot water would be completely gone. I ended up separating my shower and hair washing in two different occasions every day, and turned off the water altogether whenever I didn't need to rinse and only turned it back on when I rinsed. Luckily this May was exceptionally hot and I was able to tolerate this. I would like future reviewers to also contribute comments in this aspect and maybe when it is more than just me (and the reception staff, the cleaning lady, and two separate rooms used), the owner will acknowledge and tackle this problem. Oh one thing though, they advertise they use low flow shower head to be green, but that is not the problem... flow and water pressure has no problem...... just no hot water. I had stayed at other guest houses less nice and less cool and less clean.... but they had instant non-stop hot water supply. I have to honestly say I really really like Hop Inn, except for this problem. But if this problem is not solved.... I don't think I will go back and stay there (unless it's the peak of the summer)!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Christine C
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hop Inn Carnarvon for 5 nights in March 2012. The room is clean and the bathroom was surprisingly big for a budget inn in Hong Kong! Staffs are friendly and very helpful. Location is just excellent. 3 mins walk to Tsim Sha Tsui MTR. Convenient store, restaurants and malls are all within walking distance. Would definitely return the next time I visit Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “great Hong kong experience.”
Reviews.Author: Lordbrickwell
Reviews.Content: I didn't realize accommodation in hong kong was so expensive. It is so crazy to find a hotel within budget, Luckily I discovered Hop Inn. It had a great feel to it, really trendy and new. My room was tiny, but I was absolutely fine with that, and to be honest, If you don't like small compacted places, do not go to Hong Kong. It was a great retreat from the chaos of the city below, the common room and outdoor courtyard were lovely places to relax and have some space. The staff were the most lovely people in the world, very helpful and cheerful. You can also borrrow dvds for free, which I thought was a great idea, when some nights all you want to do is sleep and watch tv. overall, the price was great, next time I go to Hong Kong, I will absolutely be staying at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Overall is good.”
Reviews.Author: YenYean
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hop Inn Hankow for 5 nights in Apr/May 2012, traveled as couple. There are pros and cons. Pros: Good location, 2 mins walk to tsim sha tsui MTR, very near to the shopping mall isquare. Clean and modern decorated. Staffs are very friendly and accommodating. A few restaurants on the same row of road, easy to find food for supper as well. Cons: Super hard mattress, like sleeping on the wood, not good for the back. Funky smells from the plumbing in toilet. Very old air-con, a bit hard to control and a lot of noise. Do not really have good sleep quality.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely come back!”
Reviews.Author: Lianne Q
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in Hop Inn - Carnarvon last Jan. And we both loved our stay there. Our reasons are cheaper than hotels but better quality than other inns, very clean (they changed our sheets and towels everyday), very near MTR (just 2 mins away!), very near with shopping places like walking distance with harbour, very helpful and accommodating staff, love the artsy rooms, very safe even when going home late, and we love the dessert place across hop inn! A must visit! Just down side small rooms but most of the rooms in HK are small though. We will definitely stay here when we go back to HK!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget accommodation”
Reviews.Author: JongLee
Reviews.Content: Hop Inn Hankow is great. Room and toilet are tiny but clean. We got the Landscape with Traveler's Palm room. Do close the toilet door at night. There were funky smells coming from the plumbing. Might bother you while you sleep. Bed was so so. Not so great for the back. It's also a bit small so only 2 Asians would fit. Hostel is quite artsy/modern in design. Staff are also very nice and helpful. Oh and the location is very good. It's in the middle of everything. MTR is just a short walk away. Room rates are ok. Overall, it's a great hostel. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place!”
Reviews.Author: Honeybackpacker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in dec 2011. The place is trendy, cozy and so safe. There's a creative vibe to the deco of this place and i love it soooo much! Stayed at the second outlet because the first was fully-booked. Service was great and i will definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean room with good price”
Reviews.Author: kentkflee
Reviews.Content: The main selling points fof Hop Inn is obviously the price factor. If shopping is all you want in Hong Kong with a clean and secure room in a good price, this is the one. The service is good as well in terms of friendliness and helpfulness. The location is superb with lots of dining round the corner and subway to connect you easily.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget accommodation in Tsim Sha Tsui”
Reviews.Author: Wildrox
Reviews.Content: This review is for the Hop Inn on Carnarvon Road. Stayed at this place for a few nights. The entrance to the place is a bit shady, but it was just a first impression. After sleeping the jet lag off, it was OK. Always felt safe. The room was very nice. Small, clean, and very modern design. The - ensuite - bathroom was also as expected. Not huge, but very clean. The best thing about this place is the location, right in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsui. Public transportation is very easy. Walking distance to many places, Avenue of Stars, Star Ferry, etc. Did not interact much with the staff, but when it happened they were always very courteous and helpful. If I were to return to Hong Kong on a budget and space is not an issue will definitely stay here. Probably not a good place if you go with small kids. The space is too small and there isn't much to keep them entertained.

Reviews.Title: “HOP INN : acceptable, if only the management was educated.”
Reviews.Author: Georges T
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights from 12 to 16 of april 2012 in HOP INN on Carnavon Road, with my wife. The very positive side is the location near Nathan Road and the MTR. The price of the room is not really a bargain at 690 HK$ ( i.e. 89 US$). There are other places in the area which are cheaper and at least similar if not better. 1. The room is very small, what you can expect when it goes about Hong Kong. But not only the room, the bed as well is too small: 120 cms for a double bed is definitely not comfortable. Furthermore, the furniture is limited to this small bed, one side table, a TV set ( without any english language news channel ) and 3 plastic hangers on the door...There is also a bathroom ( see my pictures) with a shower , sink and toilet bowl. All together, less than 10 square meters. Clean, yes. It is clean. SInce the Inn is located on the 9th level, don't expect however to get always water in the toilet flush....better to know it before experiencing it! 2. The building is currently in renovation, and is wrapped into a kind of fishing net sustained by bamboo scaffoldings. As a result, don't be surprised if you see workers right in front of your window while you are in the bed...don't forget to close the curtains.... 3. The access to the HOP INN is rather difficult to find : a dirty corridor between the Seven/Eleven and another shop. At the end, a lift for the 9th level. Not so easy to find the first time you come there. 4. The service : well, this is a " bed without breakfast"....don't expect anything else but a small place to sleep... 5. The management : I am a smoker. I don't book any room in any hotel claiming they get a non-smoking strict policy . That's why I carefully read the webpage of the Hop Inn before booking. No one mention about this issue. So I was quite surprised that I coun't find any ashtray in the room. Since we arrived very late ( about 11 pm) I decided to smoke one of my cigarillos and to water its end before throwing it in the garbage bin. The next evening at 11.20 PM, while we were already asleep, somebody knocked at the door ; I t was a " manager" who told me that the room maid found that I smoked in the room and that it was not allowed. I tried to tell him that I never requested a no smoking room and that I was ready to move to another room. He was becoming somehow rude and unpleasant : " No way. You don't smoke in the room. You want to smoke, you go outside in the street. Is it well understood?". I closed the door.... I can't accept such an attitude since there had not been any prior notice about smoking and since when I rent a room, I am the sole and only to decide how I use it for the time I rent it. The rude and impolite attitude of this managerial member of staff has been very shocking to me. So for us, this Hop Inn could be an average place to sleep ( and only that) provided that the management should acquire some educational skills. Anyway, we won't " hop in" anymore......

Reviews.Title: “I'm hard to please but I love it!”
Reviews.Author: foreverbeglam
Reviews.Content: Stayed @Hop Inn on Carnarvon Tsim Tsa Tsui overnight 11 March 2012. It was our firt time in HK but @Hop Inn was very welcoming. Sent messages thru fb while I was @hkia and they immediately replied ;) I booked directly with them for the double room and triple room payed 10% thru paypal and payed remaining with my Unionbank Visa debit. Our room, it was simple, clean & it smells good ;) LCD TV with DVD player was perfect since it was rainin when we got in, FREE of charge. I am hard to please but I like their bathroom ;) and I've walked barefoot. Ca't wait to book with them. And their 'map' was very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great value in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: cdmm58
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hankow road hop inn for 3 nights. We expected a small room and were not disappointed. The double room is tiny with a smallish double bed, but it has air con, tv, own bathroom with hot water and good pressure. No cupboard and our two suit cases seemed to fill a lot of floor space. The location is fantastic,easy walking to the harbor and restaurants around the area are great. Temple st market is a 15 minute walk. Nathan road is 2 minutes away. All the staff are super friendly and helpful. Hong kong is an expensive city for accommodation and this place offers clean, basic accommodation for $80AUD a double in an unenviable location for hong kong.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, economical and great location”
Reviews.Author: KaiLiang
Reviews.Content: Stayed march 2012 at the carnavon road branch Near Tsim Sha Tsui MTR and just a street away from Nathan road. Room is small but cosy. Free wifi, which is the best part. Room is cleaned daily, with every thing u need in the bathroom there and clean. Walls are a little thin though. Near to pubs, local style eateries, a small shopping mall. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful, very thankful for that! For the budget traveller, u will not regret!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location!”
Reviews.Author: emptycrayonbox
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hankow branch for 5 days. Very near to the subway station. Friendly staff. Rooms are small, which is a standard in Hong Kong. Will definitely come back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and reasonably priced hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ethan Tan B
Reviews.Content: Impressed with the hotel room's unique design as well as awesome location where you have abundance of access to shopping and cafes & restaurants. The hotel staff are courteous as well helpful. Well kept and clean hotel as well as decent facilities provided.

Reviews.Title: “New, clean, quiet, comfortable & hospitable”
Reviews.Author: AngHB
Reviews.Content: Inn has all that I can ask for a HK accommodation. Other than the cold room and building works going on, it would hv been the most perfect stay for the price. Staff was kind enough to give me extra quilt without me asking.

Reviews.Title: “"Pure Art"”
Reviews.Author: justyannis
Reviews.Content: The best accommodation you can get in this price. Great location,very clean and safe,free wi-fi and the best staff,always helpful and smiling.We had a reservation for 2 people,but another friend wanted to join us.Hop Inn changed our reservation although we requested that late and most of the time the rooms are full. I really appreciated this. The rooms are pure art,amazing decoration,different in every room. We stayed 5 nights in the new Hop Inn,at Carnarvon and I have nothing negative to say. Only a big thanks to the people that work there.Greetings from Greece.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: joyceting
Reviews.Content: When we first reached TST MTR, we got off from the wrong exit. Just remember to go out from A2 exit, walk all the way straight, it should be around humphreys ave. As Carnarvon road is pretty LONG, be sure to take the map at the airport to look for the inn first, as my friends and I really got lost looking for the inn. As the whole building was under contruction, it is pretty easy to identify, just look for the building with "construction". A really good location i should say, many many shops downstairs and friendly staff. Staff told us about various different shopping areas as it was our main motive. Btw, you have to pay the full amount upon check in. Would certainly stay again at Hop Inn if I were to visit Hong Kong again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in HK!”
Reviews.Author: liyun86
Reviews.Content: This hostel is a STEAL! I adored the graphic illustrated rooms that is different in every room and the location is SO ideal! Just 2 mins walk from TST station and there are tons of eatery around the area and Mcdonalds is just across the road. The building is currently under renovation so it was kind of hard to locate. Just look for 7-11, the entrance is right beside the store. The room is considered big for HK hostel standard (having stayed at 2 hostels at HK before) and I love it that they have water dispenser, DVDs for rent that I could watch in the comfort of my own room. Comfortable beds too~ Free wifi in the room as well! WILL DEFINITELY stay again when I visit Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Great hostel to stay in”
Reviews.Author: Jonas L
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Carnarvon location with my wife and son for 2 nights. This was the first time for me to stay in a hostel. My brother and his friends were also going to stay here for the trip so I decided to check the reviews on Tripadvisor, which convinced me to book for 3 nights. Unfortunately, rooms were not available on our first night so I had to book a night with a nearby hotel along Pratt avenue which was just a few steps away. I almost missed the place while looking for it as the entrance to the building was small and you will only see the "hop inn" sign on the wall once you go inside the building. Although the building entrance and the tiny elevator were uninviting(the lift can only fit 4-5 passengers, 3 at most if you have luggage), all these changed once we reached hop-inn at the 9th floor. The staff were warm and very accommodating, the place was clean, comfortable and very interesting. We got a room with 2 single beds (P-1), which we moved to join the 2 beds together, do not expect much room amenities as there are only the beds, an LCD TV with a DVD player and hooks and hangers on the door. The room and the bathroom are small but functional. The room was painted in white and had green and red camouflage patterns on the ceiling, on the wall was a green and a red soldier embracing each other - "love your enemies" was the caption. There is free wi-fi, which was fast but we were getting frequent disconnections - the staff told us that they were indeed having problems with it. There was free drinking water down another corridor. A cool "common room" with reading stuff, card and board games, and a football game which my son was very fond of. A door from the common room leads out to an open area "roof deck". They have a collection of DVD's which you can borrow, kettle for boiling water and power adaptors are also available. The location is very central and ideal as shopping, dining and interesting spots are all around. The MTR, bus station and the Star ferry are also near the place. Hop-inn offers good value if you are traveling on a budget and if you don't mind the small room space. I recommend you get the bigger rooms just to give you some space to move around. I would definitely have Hop-Inn on my list the next time I go back to Hongkong.

Reviews.Title: “Great stop over spot!”
Reviews.Author: AdventureSparrow
Reviews.Content: We had an over night layover in HK and just wanted somewhere central to crash, Hop Inn gave us so much more!! Nestled in TST this place is definitely the HK real deal - small lift (between 3 of us and our gear we had to go up in 2 groups!), small rooms but perfect for us. The rooms, like I said, are small but very well designed - bed, shower, window - excellent. Don't expect bells and whistles furniture or amenity wise, the rooms have everything you need for a cheap, convenient stay. My Dad took the room with no window and said he had the best sleep in weeks - so those who like a dark quiet spot to snooze after adventuring you're in luck. The location is great, steps from the MTR, Haagen Das across the street, Circle Ks abounding and a big mall right down the way (this is useful because you have a large landmark you can see while rambling Kowloon to keep tabs on how far you are from home!). The directions given by Hop Inn are great and lead you right to the hostel, print them out and follow them exactly, its easy to get distracted by all the lights and signs but stick to their instructions and you'll end up right where you need to be. Make sure you grab a business card before you head out, they have directions for taxi drivers on the back which comes in handy. Really enjoyed my brief time at Hop Inn, I've found my HK layover haven!

Reviews.Title: “A hostel worth staying on every HK trip!”
Reviews.Author: xnikolai
Reviews.Content: I booked a quadruple room for the first night and a triple room for the second night; they upgraded the triple room to a quadruple room without any charge! The staff were very friendly and courteous. They even found and fixed something the belong to my god daughter! Rooms are very nice and clean with a minimalistic look. Restrooms are also clean with toiletries and hot water available. Room comes with a cable TV and a complimentary fast wifi. You can also borrow laptops/tablets from the front desk for free! There's hot and cold drinking water available which is great. The location's very accessible also; we stayed in Hop Inn in Carnarvon and it's just a stone's throw away (1-minute walk) from MTR Tsim Sha Tsui Station. One thing for improvement though is that the walls are not that sound-proof; I can hear people showering from other rooms during the middle of night. Overall, I would love to stay in Hop Inn again next time I go to HK!

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: sunnytsui
Reviews.Content: Great hostel, very friendly front desk people, small room but nice and clean. Free wifi available. The location is convenient, 1 minute's walking to MTR station, 30 seconds' walking to Nathan Road.

Reviews.Title: “Great hostel”
Reviews.Author: Aidan O
Reviews.Content: Great hostel and location on Carnarvon Rd. Very cool fit out and helpful staff. Make sure you ask for a room with windows though!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was ok, except the smell in the room”
Reviews.Author: Rain T
Reviews.Content: Stayed @ Hop inn on hankow for 2 nights last month. Room clean, wifi functioning, quiet, accessible, service staff friendly. Everything was ok about the room, except for the smell that permeated into my room each night. It was the smell coming up from the restaurant at the ground floor. The smell lingered in the room throughout the night, despite having the aircon and fan running at full. Informed the reception about the problem, but there was nothing that it could be done to rectify the problem. As a result, my sleep was interrupted and I had to wear a face mask while I was in the room. The smell even lingered on my clothes and hair. For that, I would give it a poor score.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem of a place.”
Reviews.Author: Keylimelimepie
Reviews.Content: A haven of calm and quiet. Friendly knowledgable staff. Clean modern rooms, excellent facilities, handy location, good value for money. A perfect base for exploring an incredible city.

Reviews.Title: “Chinese New Year”
Reviews.Author: bondasan
Reviews.Content: Small lovely rooms, each room as a peace of art, very friendly staff and great, great terrace, huge choice of movies, perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: MyMaleta
Reviews.Content: After reading a lot of reviews on where to stay in HK, I'm glad we decided to go with Hop Inn at Hankow. It's a hostel and so I did already expect to see small rooms and only basic amenities, but the whimsical decor, safe environment, strategic location and personable staff all made up for it. A few cons: Our toilet made this prolonged loud noise every time it was flushed (also the adjacent room's toilet) and we could hear muffled sounds of conversation whenever people hung out in the reception area. Other than that, nothing to complain about really. Our room was clean, no funky smell, no weird stains. TV, A/C and shower worked fine. Requests were attended to. Check-in and check-out were hassle-free (and we were allowed to check in early since the room was ready when we got there at 12 pm...great!). Value for money. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “All excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Kikoenmexico
Reviews.Content: I just spent two nights at the Inn (Carnarvan site) and it was great. The rooms at this site (there are 2) were bigger than the pix and spotless. You can't beat the location-walking distance to Star Ferry one way and the night market the other- and a block off Nathan Road is quiet. All the staff were beyond excellent: great advice, pleasant and very knowledgable. Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Budget Lodging”
Reviews.Author: Kamal_Narang
Reviews.Content: A clean budget lodge in the heart of TST, Hong Kong. A perfect place for short stays specially for people on a low budget in Hong Kong. Much much better than any other place like Chung King Mansion or Mirador Mansion. This place is clean, has free wi-fi, rooms are sufficiently decorated with dustbins, attached toilets, clean bed, LCD TV and Air conditioning. The staff in particular is extremely sweet and well behaved. Location is amazing - very close to all the shopping, sight seeing and central to travel anywhere in HK. Most recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hop Inn Carnavorn”
Reviews.Author: Vindhya
Reviews.Content: nice hotel. small but clean. good location but difficult to find because no signage in the building. great staff. recommended!

Reviews.Title: “highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: jessjuice
Reviews.Content: Hop Inn Carnarvon - we stayed over New Years and the location was fabulous, super central, easy to find, 2 mins from closest MTR and shopping, 5mins walk to harbor...super friendly and helpful staff, full of recommendations for us. Rooms were cute, small (but to be expected in HK) and clean. Fresh white linens and towels, very minimalist. Safes to rent in reception were an added bonus, as well as the DVD library in the common room (which had a huge roof top deck to use) that we could take to our room. Laptops and hair dryers on request, even a steamer for clothes. Hotel was quiet and had CCTV everywhere and the rooms had key card access so we felt very safe. I would stay again and recommend to others ;)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a quick night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: Archaic123
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located; nice rooms (very small but cozy) which are very clean and well maintained. Very helpful staff. Plus free wifi. Truly value for money. The only negative - difficult to find. No sign boards/directions.

Reviews.Title: “Room is clean , good location , nice service”
Reviews.Author: Pajaree
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel is very good room is a bit tiny but very clean. Staff was nice and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean facilities”
Reviews.Author: shore9
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay right in the heart of Kowloon. It was very centrally located and the facilities are very good and modern. The friendly staff were extremely helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Luv The Place”
Reviews.Author: WendyTan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hop Inn @ Carnarvorn Branch for 2 nights. It was actually something that my friends and me found while surfing on the web for budget accommodations since hotel room rates in Hk is known to be expensive. Luv the location and place as everything from retail to dining outlets is at the door-step. Certainly delighted that there is a 7-11 just next to Hop Inn and Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station is just less than a minute walk away. Comparing to Yes Inn @ Fortress Hill which my friends and I stayed for 2 nights before we headed to Macau & Zhuhai, I definedly prefer Hop Inn as the rooms are newer and more centrally located. What was impressive is that they actually deck up the place with Christmas Ornaments since Christmas is round the corner. There is also a common room where you can play table-soccer game & books to borrow plus the roof top area to chill out. Like what my friends commented … the roof top area is exactly what we always see from TVB Dramas. Check-in was quick and easy and the place was easy to find. The staff showed us to our 4-bedder room which comes with a double-deck bed and a so-called double bed. I thought the double bed was a little too small to be shared with 2 person. Thus, was pleasantly glad when a friend pointed out that there was a pull-out bed under the double-deck bed. The staff also explained to us that each room has different wall drawings and décor and ours was apparently drawn by a 5 year old girl. Very impressive indeed. Toilet is very small though but manageable. Having always stayed at hotels whenever I travel, I find that Hop Inn was a very nice alternative and had made my stay a very comfortable one. Room is simple and had an artistic feel to it. The price is reasonable and not too heavy on the pocket. Perfect for a budget traveler like me. Hop Inn is highly recommended and I will definedly be staying there again during my next trip to HK. Lastly, will like to also commend that the staff there are really friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: bjorn99
Reviews.Content: Great location, really nice and helpful people running the hostel, clean sheets and towels every day, and relatively cheap. Small rooms, but so are all rooms in HG. Its in the middle of Kowloon, so might be a bit noisy at night for certain people, but did not bother me at all. (but the bed was not great though). But in conclusion: an excellent hostel, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: alexacsf
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here during our trip in November 2011. We stayed here for a week and we have no complaints! Staff here were friendly and helpful, and they mostly speak good English. The hotel rates are very affordable considering the location which is close to Tsim Sha Tsui station and you can get food anywhere! It is also very easily accesible from the airport, just take the A21 bus. The room is small but the bed is comfortable and the facility is very very clean. We are out sightseeing and shopping most of the time and only spend the time in the hostel to sleep and use the internet at night. The internet connection is free and very very fast! The housekeeper keeps our room clean every day. I would definitely recommend this place to others!

Reviews.Title: “No frills but great value”
Reviews.Author: Occidio-Vivo
Reviews.Content: Hop inn provides a great location at an unbeatable price. The hotel fit the three requirements that we were looking for: 1) it was affordable 2) it was in a great location 3) it was safe! After finding about this place it seemed too good to be true. Tsim Sha Tsui is a very central location allowing access to 2 subway stations that are less than 5 mins walking distance. Getting to the harbor and the Harbour city mall is a 10 minute walk. Needless to say, it's a pretty central location. Tsim Sha Tsui is also party central at night for younger adults/teens so on the weekends there is activity going on well into the night. For the older crowds looking for some fun, heading into Central station, 3 stops away from Tsim Sha Tsui is a must. Just be aware that the subways close at 12 so taking a taxi back home will be necessary. The hotel itself is safe and clean though with no-frills. There is no clock, no tables, not even a spring mattress but me and my wife had no problems sleeping. One thing that will be harder to get used to are the washrooms. They are very small and Hong Kong style which means the toilet and the shower are in the same small space. When you shower, everything gets wet, sink toilet I mean everything! The decision to use clear glass as walls was also very peculiar though tree is a translucent shower curtain. Odd! The staff all speak English and are very helpful. Hair dryers are offered but you need to ask the front desk to use them. Plug adapters are also provided with a $10 refundable deposit. The biggest pain is waiting for the elevators. Though there are two of them, only one of them serves the odd numbered floors while the other services the even numbers. This means you only have one elevator to access the hotel and because it is on the top floor it takes forever. Overall though it's a no frills hotel I would not hesitate to stay there again as the place is an incredible value for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but really tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Marloud
Reviews.Content: Lets start with the positive aspects. As said by most previous review, the hotel is located in the hearth of action and the staff is helpful, very friendly and speaks well english. The price is also very cheap for a place to sleep in Hong Kong. Now the negative points. First of all, the rooms are amazingly small. They contain just a bed, a tv and a small bathroom in which toilets and shower are put together. I booked first the single room which does not have any windows and in which I was barely fitting with my luggage. I spent an horrible night with the airco blowing directly on my face and on a matress hard as wood. Honestly, during my previous travels in Asia (Japan, Korea), I accommodated myself with small and no so comfortable rooms, but here it was too much (and I am a small guy, 1m68 tall). For the second night, I changed to the triple room in which, according to me, only two persons can fit. I slept a bit better, but still, there was a lot of noise from people in the hotel and these f...ing hard matresses! So, my conclusion is that you should not expect to be able to get a good rest at this hotel. Go there if you are really short on money and that you plan to party in Tsim Sha Tsui before coming back to this place for collapsing after heavy drinking.

Reviews.Title: “acceptable”
Reviews.Author: derk_kort
Reviews.Content: The room clean and furnished with the bare minimum of what you can expect. (no room for a seat, desk or anything else). I had the double room, which is OK on your own, but the bed (and space) would be too small for 2 people. Staff is friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and super-friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DublinVinnieC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in Oct 2011. The location is excellent in downtown Kowloon and easy to access local attractions and public transport. The en-suite single room that I stayed in was the smallest hotel room ever - at approx 6 square metres - but somehow it worked! I really only needed a central, clean, comfortable place to sleep and it ticked all of those boxes. The 'Inn' is not a conventional hotel but rather a second floor of rooms in an apartment type building. Once I got used to that it was not a problem. The various staff members that I met there were extremely friendly and helpful so overall I would give this place a good recommendation if you are a budget traveller not looking for any frills but just a good sleep location. One slight downside was a lot of noisy children that woke me a bit early one morning (after a late night) but I was happy to be up and out seeing the sights of HK a bit early anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our HK trip!”
Reviews.Author: Ann B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Hong Kong just about a week ago. I'm glad we chose Hop Inn in Carnavorn. For the reservation, we chatted with Hop Inn via Skype and they were able to answer all our queries. We arrived in HK just a little past mid night and they were expecting us. All of the staff knows how to speak English clearly. They were very accommodating . The rooms and the bathrooms were small but very very clean!!!! To save money, you can bring your own water bottle because Hop Inn provides drinking water (hot/room temp). Hop Inn Carnavorn is just 3 minutes away from the nearest MTR station. Even after we checked out, we stayed in the lounge and it was very relaxing still. The staff were still friendly and accomodating :) To be fair, the only thing that they can improve is the pillows because we only had 2 in our bedroom and when we asked for extra, they said they ran out of pillows and gave us extra comforters instead. (which worked for us luckily) If your intention in Hong Kong is to go out and explore the metro the entire day, Hop Inn is the perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Five star service”
Reviews.Author: preegift
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hop Inn on the 14th - 18th Nov. It was quite hard to find the building at first but it got easier and easier after that. I must say, for the price you're paying.. you're getting the best service and the best location! Right in the middle of the city and i mean it, its in the center of everything. A very very short walk to the MTR is probably the best thing about this place, oh and the staffs too! All the staffs are very very friendly but i'd like to mention Shiu (or Shoe, sorry if ive mispelled her name) is the most attentive and most caring staff ive ever encountered. Always smiling and always greeting me each time she sees me. The rooms were exactly like that on the website. At night it was safe to walk and their were a couple of bars and restaurants near the hotel. Id really recommend this place to anyone who just wants to pay low price but get great service and great location.

Reviews.Title: “great location and price”
Reviews.Author: sparkplugfreak
Reviews.Content: in the heart of kowloon district really safe to walk around the area even during late nights, 5 mins away from the trains (mtr) walking distance to the big specialty stores, 10 min walk to the avenue of stars really great. rooms are small but for the location you've got a great deal. friendly staff especially joyce. only thing lacking is they have no ice cubes plus you have to request for new sheets and towels but they will immediately provide upon request. compared to my hotel now (pop hotel) hop inn is definitely hands down better

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Choice for HK”
Reviews.Author: catherinealexis
Reviews.Content: For under $100 a night Hop Inn is a great Hong Kong Option. As a tourist it is centrally located with a friendly staff and clean simple accommodations with a some interesting artistic details. The only downside is some of the rooms lack windows. In the building on the same floor is a cafe and a vintage chinese clothing shop.

Reviews.Title: “Still to visit next week”
Reviews.Author: baksy39
Reviews.Content: Will be stayin @ Carnarvon next week , upon reviews I'm quite exciting that my stay would be lovely even though on a budget basis. Although I'm not sure if to ask any questions i need some help on which is the easiest trip to reach hotel from HKIA.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great and helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: Rafael L
Reviews.Content: I have actually stayed at the new Hop inn in carnarvon St. The hostel is just great, its very well located, rooms are very clean, it is small, but for this price, you wont stay at the Hilton, right? To get there from the airport, choose the A21 bus, rather than the train, its easier, once you get to bus stop 13, you will be two blocks away from it. When you get there, it will be a little scary, as the hostel is locate in a commercial building, and its reception doesn’t look really nice, don't worry get in the lift, you will feel safe up there! There is a Mcdonalds across the road, great usual breakfast, KFC half block away, and plenty of Chinese restaurants around, try the fish ball, typical HK dish. I think the hostel should have more touristic information at the reception, such as the symphony of lights, on the stars avenue. But recommend it very much

Reviews.Title: “Great location, and really nice staff”
Reviews.Author: francinetutor
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 nights in August. This place is pretty much a very nice hostel. For a hostel, it was pretty clean. They were very nice, and they took care of my problem. I accidently brought bed bugs from my university, where I had previously stayed. They were very nice though, they took care of my clothes, and they had somebody come in to steam the room to kill the bugs. The room was really small. And the bathroom was a glass shower with a toilet and sink inside. So, when you shower, the toilet gets a little wet. However, there is a curtain for privacy. Just look at the photos to see what I mean. It was a good, cheap place to get what I need (sleep, shower) and go explore Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “convenient and cozy place=)”
Reviews.Author: ShuZhen1212
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 days at this cozy place. Good side 1) Booking and confirmation of rooms: easy and fast. 2) located very near MTR station!! 3) staffs are really nice, can help u and intro places to you 4) free wifi, free water, free rental of hairdryer, dvd, what's more can u ask for? Down side: 1) stayed at a room which air con did not work well! time to change your aircon 2) required to change room as someone else who booked the room will be moving in later on. 3) unlucky;;;;;changed to a room with better aircon but poor WALL soundProof! can literally hear the sewage, water dripping sound, people talking in another room. =( overall, still a cozy place. price a bit pricey tho.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Helpful Hop Inn”
Reviews.Author: ek1973
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hop Inn , Carnarvon Raod and I found it is very nice. You can ensure that your stay will be good since you get confirmation. I did. The staff are willing to help you with almost everything you want to know about HK. With less is more philosophy with artists' design, it is worth staying here. What you can ask more if you feel happy and relaxed , and the staff are helpful ? It is easy to get around , you just walk a few minutes to the subway. The 7-11 shop is next door and walk a little further you can catch the shuttle bus to the airport express station. I will stay at Hop Inn next time I visit HK. So goooooooooooood ! Kittipong, Thailand

Reviews.Title: “Easy to locate!”
Reviews.Author: ShinaG
Reviews.Content: What I like most about Hop Inn is the location, next is the unique and artsy feeling once you stepped in. I got busy reading almost everything posted on their boards. Some rooms are quite big but unfortunately we stayed in Room 2 which is their smallest room. In my opinion, the rate is quite pricey. We paid 610HKD/night for the smallest room. How I wish they can lower down the price. Other than that, everything is OK. They have fast wifi connection, working hot/cold shower, cable TV, and a quiet AC! With regards to service, there's only one staff (a old woman) who doesn't want to change our bed sheet. We found a stain and asked if they can change it. She said that it is clean and that they only change sheets like every 2 days (for conservation purposes). She talks too much and insisted that if there is a stain she is pretty sure that it is not blood. I guess all she needs to do is check it, and change it. So as not to make a big scene out of it, I just said that maybe it is just rust or something. The night was young, and I don't want to ruin it. The rest of the staff are very friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value.”
Reviews.Author: acoolbreeze
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time researching places to stay for my first visit to HK. I'm glad I found the Hop Inn. I stayed at the TST location which was perfect. It is surrounded by MTR entrances, a few minutes to Nathan Road and a 5 minute walk to the Star Ferry. Yes, rooms are small, as advertised, but are clean and adequate. Staff were excellent and helpful. Wifi was also an excellent added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: PersianCook
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews on here and decided to go with them, and didn't regret a moment of it. Located centrally in TST minutes away from everything, the location was perfect. The real stars are the staff who were incredibly helpful and very friendly. Beds are a bit on the stiff side, and be ready for a bit of noise at night, but otherwise a great choice. Also a little tricky to find.cheers

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: DCIII
Reviews.Content: This place is located right in the middle of everything on the Kowloon side and the people running the front desk while we stayed there were very kind and helpful. The rooms however are very very small but it's not like they're keeping it a secret, you see them all on their website. I was also traveling with three people and the room size would've worked just fine for two of us. Once again though, the location is really good, close to the water, the MTR, Nathan Road, the night market, everything is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back! There's no doubt about it!”
Reviews.Author: PapsKing
Reviews.Content: Hop Inn is a hop away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Strategically located in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsui, Hop Inn is minutes away from shopping, dining and the MTR. The staff at Hop Inn are (very) friendly and accommodating. With some of them having worked at the Hong Kong Tourism Board, the recommendations for cheap and great eats are spot on! They will be opening up another branch not too far away in the near future. Bring earplugs as the powerful shower may get a bit noisy at times. This place is a gem and worth keeping in your little black book of places to stay. It has made a mark in mine!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good service”
Reviews.Author: Filisa
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel, the rooms are lovely and the bed was incredibly comfortable. The food was great and the staffs were nice. The location was great , too. Overall a great choice if you want to have a good relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hostel in Tsim Sha Tsui”
Reviews.Author: iMadzy
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research I decided to stay over here, as a hostel rookie, I didn't know what to expect from a hostel. Hop inn is easy to find, just print the map from their website and keep it close to you. I took the airport express to Kowloon, then the free shuttle bus to the Peninsula hotel, it's a 10 minutes walk to the hostel. The staff is very friendly! And answered all my questions. Although it's a hostel, the service is A+ I had a single room for 9 nights, the room is small, but convenient. I've read reviews about noisy rooms, but I didn't hear any noise. The best thing about Hop inn is the location! 7/11 around the corner, MTR and shoppingmalls (iSquare & Harbourcity). It takes about 10~15 minutes walking to see the HK skyline and lightshow at 08.00 pm. Another great thing is the free WIFI and the security. They have CCTV to keep an eye and they keep track of people who come in and leave the hostel. As a female travelling alone, safety is very important to me and this hostel is very safe. I recommend this hostel if you want to stay at a friendly place and a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Bed mites and one rude staff”
Reviews.Author: rachelchew
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 4 nights in Room #2 with my sister. We shared a smallish queen sized bed and my first impression was that the bed was too hard for my liking, but dismissed it cos I've slept on a wooden floor before so this should be alright. But I couldn't sleep because the mattress was slanting on one side. The whole night felt like I was sleeping on a slope. Eventually I fell asleep when the sun was about to rise. Later, I woke up to find usual bumps on my arm and thigh. My sister had what seemed like a mosquito bite on her thigh too although we didn't notice a mosquito in the room throughout our entire stay. So every night my sister and I scratched ourselves, thinking that maybe we can't sleep cos of the slanted bed but then I checked the raised blister-like bumps on my arm to realize that we were bitten by bed mites. I had a bite on my cheek too unfortunately. One of their late-night staff wasn't very helpful or friendly too (didn't catch his name but he had long hair). When my sister requested for another blanket, he told her to wait 10 minutes for him to look for the cover for the blanket and then to stuff it in. He said it's hard to reach. She returned more than 10 minutes later only to find him behind the counter on Facebook. She asked for the blanket and was greeted in an irritated manner, as though she was intruding into his Facebook time. Sighing and fumbling with his words—and reluctantly— he said he forgot and has to grab a chair to reach it cos it was stored too high up. In the end, he grudgingly gave her a piece of blanket that didn't require a cover and went back to face his computer. Apart from that one rude staff, the rest were polite, helpful and friendly. If not for the condition of the bed, we would have a thoroughly enjoyable stay. The bed mite bites are clear indications that the bed and sheets need proper cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “APPROVED :)”
Reviews.Author: rachellow
Reviews.Content: For travellers looking to stay at Hop Inn, I'd start off by telling you "Yes, it's worth the stay!" THE ROOM: I stayed for a total of 6 nights, and got to stay in two of their rooms, White Tone (triple room: 1 queen size + 1 single) and Altostratus (twin bunkbed). Needless to say, the rooms aren't gigantic but nice, clean and cosy. I'm a complete sucker for well-designed rooms! With "strategic positioning" you can fit 3 medium-sized luggage on the floor and still walk about freely. Though the twin bunkbed (Altostratus) room appears to be small, luggages can be tucked under the bed, creating more room. Both the rooms' toilets were clean. BUT you might be disturbed by the room next door when they shower in the wee hours of the morning, IF you are a light sleeper. Oh the noise coming from the heater or shower head :( +ve: FREE WIFI - extremely useful, helps me save on data roaming charges / can borrow laptop from the reception FEEDBACK TO HOP INN: It'd be good if you all add more hooks around the room/toilet. Since the only ones available are those attached to the door - too close together, we had to find means and ways to hang/air our damp towels after showering. What else do I like about Hop Inn? (1) Location: Only about 5 minutes away from the train station, and away from the hustle and bustle you find along the busy streets. That means you'll get a good night's rest. Nearby you can find shops that sell nice, cheap clothes and goodies from Macau too! BUT if you're new to HK like I was, when you alight from the airport bus, you may have to ask around for directions. I recommend somebody from a shop, not a random stranger along the streets since I witnessed touting going on (around 10, 11+ at night). (2) Safety: There'll always be a staff seated at the reception, next to the main door so...can we safely say it's hard for strangers to intrude? They will check which room you're staying in. Also, the door is always locked with a password - so the only way to access from outside is by buzzing the doorbell and wait for the hostel staff to attend to you. (3) Service: Almost everyday, it's a new face. Service is fairly consistent, and good. They'd be glad to assist you in any way possible (I guess!)

Reviews.Title: “Kind of the best to stay in TST area(center of downtown Hong Kong)”
Reviews.Author: tak3406
Reviews.Content: Location is the best, about 3 minutes walk to Peninsula Hotel Hong Kong as well as 2 minutes walk to Nathern Road. Many local restaurants nearby with reasonable price . Free drinking water/hot water server. Room is small but very clean and comfortable with window, private shower and toilet. Security is very good and safe to keep your valuables in the room, of cause reception may keep it in its safe. Free wi-fi internet in the room, TV with DVD player and many free DVD movies for guest, no telephone in the room but reception staff may assist to use their mobile for city call only as free charge. Owner and staffs are excellent, has value to stay.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE HOP INN”
Reviews.Author: Elliesiew
Reviews.Content: is beyond my expectation! clean and comfort hostel! the location is very strategic which u can shop and get to the MTR! the hostel is very nearly the avenue star and the museum! their service are very good! very polite and very helpful! keep provide us the tourist info =)

Reviews.Title: “The staff is not polite”
Reviews.Author: donidw
Reviews.Content: I stay in Hong Kong for one week, and decided to try the hospitality of a hostel for the first time. From the review I've red, this is the number one hostel in HK, and very recomended also clean. But what happen there is not as what I've expected. This is not the owner fault, as they welcome us very well, and I didn't have problem with the policy or so on. The problem begin when we found out the bunk bed room is way too small for us. My wife is pregnant and my weight is almost 90kg, so I'm afraid I will wreck their bed if I sleep on the top of the bed. On the first night after several hours trying so hard to sleep, I come to the receptionist and found the most snobish person I've ever met. I've asked about whether we can move to the triple room, because that night around 2 AM nobody is coming. The reception a middle aged man, with long hair, and Tshirt, said that somebody is coming. And when my wife asked him again (around 3 AM) he's shouted angrily and said that he was very busy ( I look at his PC & I thought he was busy facebooking). My wife said, it's only because we couldn't sleep that's she has to asked for the second time, there's no need to be rude. I know it's not their fault, but it's not like I'm doing that in purpose either. The next morning we move to Hankow Hotel, just a few step from the Hostel and decided to move. The Hostel owner offer to sell our room to another person that might come by, and at the end of our 4 nights stay, only one person come and rent our bunk bed (she move on the next morning too). We've paid 5500 HKD and lost around 4000 HKD (I've rent one bunk bed & one triple room for 4 night) . This is not about the money, because I understand their policy and I respect it. But the owner might consider to pay a staff who has more emphaty, than a rubbish like that man.

Reviews.Title: “Love comfy room”
Reviews.Author: Nichy_Tarn
Reviews.Content: A comfy guest house located in a very good location heart of Tsim Sha Tsui. Just a few step walk to underground Tsim sha Tsui station and close to shopping mall which all everything you need is around you. Very friendly and helpful staff. Wish i can visit again soon and ofcouse with a few of my friend with this time :) Nicha Tips : Must take shopping bag close to u when shopping HK every plastic bag charge 50 Cent every shop even 7-11

Reviews.Title: “The best hostel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Smashing2
Reviews.Content: This is the best hostel that I've ever stayed at! I stayed in the single room which wasn't more than a mattress, air conditioning and shower, but that's all I needed and all I was looking for. It's a tight fit with a suitcase but the room, bed and shower was clean. Free wifi is available throughout the hostel and there's a staff at the desk 24/7. Safety is not a problem as the front door is always locked and guests need to buzz in and out. The staff also keep track of which guests are "home" or have gone out. The location is in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsui, less than a 5 minute walk door to door to the MTR platform. You're surrounded by dozens of restaurants and shops. Laundry is a 1 minute walk away. The Star Ferry is 10 minutes away. I'm surprised that the owners don't charge more per night because the rates are an absolute steal. The downside is that the walls are a bit thin. Hallway and street noise come into the room quite easily. It's not much more than a place to sleep, but even then Hop Inn provides daily housekeeping. I also saw the double bunk bed room which looks like it would feel tight unless you really know and are comfortable with your travel companion. Highly recommended for individuals and couples if you're not spending much time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “An affordable place to rest and recover in TST before the next adventure in to the heat and chaos of Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Spiritof87
