Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice, last year and this. Each room has a different theme and so makes a pleasant change. The staff are young, friendly and willing to help. More expensive than hostels based in Chunking Mansions but far safer.

Reviews.Title: “Hop Inn - perfect spot, clean, friendly - ideal!”
Reviews.Author: Sarahobvt
Reviews.Content: I had one night tagged onto a business trip to spend touring in Hong Kong - my first visit. Hop Inn was ideally located - near ferry, Tsim Sha Tsui, Kowloon park, Nathan Road, and just a quick MTR trip from Mongkok markets or Central. Great directions for getting there provided without my asking, clean, well arranged room, air conditioning and TV, clean linens, hot shower - really couldn't have asked for more for the incredibly reasonable price! And the people staffing the desk were friendly, cheerful, efficient - I received an email confirmation of payment after arriving maybe 5 minutes after I paid. I was able to leave my bags in the morning right near the desk - felt confident that they were in a safe spot, and found them already in my room when I returned that evening. Yes my room (single) was tiny - but it had everything I needed and I was only there to sleep - and I saw at least one room - with a double and single bed - that looked very spacious!. I am definitely filing away this lodging choice for any future visit to Hong Kong - recommend it highly for anyone who wants a centrally located, safe, inexpensive option.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: fruitjunkie
Reviews.Content: Both me and my girl friend made a shopping trip to HK so we decided to stay in hop inn, tsim sa tsui. Location is good. Near to the jetty, subways.. And has lots of taxi/ bus. We booked a room with double decker bed. The room is very small, no space to put extra luggage, you would need to tuck the luggage under the bed.love the design of the rooms tho, creative painting. Room has no window. Toilet Is a good size. Love the toilet n room design. White bathroom! With shampoo n bath gel provided. Altho small, the room n bathroom is very clean! Love the smell of detol each time we came from shopping. N I like it! Plus point : free wi fi! and water dispenser is also available at the corridor. The front desk reception is also very helpful n friendly. She even lend us umbrellas when the weather didn't look as sunny. Very nice gesture. Gave us a Lot of info bout shopping in HK! However, they do not offer laundry services in hop inn. Enjoyed our stay here, since the room is just for us to sleep n we are out most of the day. I would definitely recommend this place for ppl who just wants a clean n comfy room to bunk in n is out most of the day!

Reviews.Title: “best value”
Reviews.Author: MrAshish
Reviews.Content: Location, Value, Basic, Safe, Helpful.. that probably describes all about Hop Inn. Location is among the best and for the price, you will find it tough to find a clearner and more friendly place. Rooms are tiny, but atleast the staff are so friendly and helpful.. that if you are a first time visitor to hong kong.. you will love every bit of help they extend. its useful only if you plan to come here and sleep.. forget anything else.. ideal if you are a backpacker and in for a night or two and need to only get a nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Sometimes the staff are what define a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jenovard
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay here again, and plan to on my next trip, so I highly recommend it to anyone that is considering a trip to Hong Kong. I enjoyed my stay at Hop Inn. In particular all of the staff that I met were really friendly. My room was comfortable and the hotel felt like a secluded escape from the craziness on the streets below. I was in the Rebecca Yip Bird Lovers room which I liked, but there was construction going on across the street I believe which made it a bit loud in the mornings. At night I enjoyed hearing the people below though and the room gets excellent lighting. The staff were also kind enough to loan a power cable converter for a cheap $10HK deposit which was returned to me when I checked out. They were also very helpful and easy to talk to.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, indie interior and good value!”
Reviews.Author: viroze
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Halloween weekend last year. Halloween here is more like an anime convention than a traditional trick or treat, but it's worth to experience it in Lan Kwai Fong if you love the night life. Bought some costumes (a wig) in ladies market :) The co-owners, Simon and Wilson gave us heaps of local tips and insights, and yes, they speak perfect English, which is a plus in HK. Also, great location, which is a stroll away from the station. Everything is nearby from pharmacy to convenience store to restaurants. The room is a bit tiny, which is a typical HK setup where everything is crammed up. Stayed in the first room where I can hear people walk by as they enter the hostel :( Other than that, love the funky drawings on the wall and the tiny details on the spotlight.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: DEEBS57
Reviews.Content: I found the room very small,my husband didn't like it but we both agree the service and location was excellant. The staff were terrific and if I go back without my husband would definatley stay there again. I think that for the extra couple of dollars you really need the triple room just for a little extra space. If you are a large person/ couple I think you will find the beds very small more like a king single rather than a double and very hard.

Reviews.Title: “the future I will come back stay here again”
Reviews.Author: kajeab
Reviews.Content: Hotel very well located close to shopping and restaurants. The important owners are very kind. Assistance as well.

Reviews.Title: “Trim your tummy to use the toilet.”
Reviews.Author: RameshMysore
Reviews.Content: Invariably I look up for comments in 'Trip Advisor' before proceeding to book hotels during my foreign trips - generally as a tourist. Hop Inn was my natural choice, when I visited Hongkong in the third week of Jan 11. But for the first time, we were disappointed with this highly rated hotel. Though staff were courteous and spoke good English, room was painfully small, and the toilet smaller. Even privacy in the toilet is limited. You can see the spouse's every movement inside the toilet!! And what is more, you have to literally squeeze in to enter the bath. NO ADMISSION FOR OVERWEIGHT CHAPS TO THE BATHROOM - NO JOKES!! So watch your weight before booking this hotel, which is ideally located in the centre of Hongkong. Yes, it is centrally located, very near to Nathan street, and right below the hotel is an Indian restaurant serving authentic Indian food, though quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in a good area.”
Reviews.Author: leleg
Reviews.Content: super clean and cozy room, really sweet, laid back staff and location is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great Discovery”
Reviews.Author: liyaiism
Reviews.Content: A five day girls getaway. Great location(shops, restaurants and subway nearby), clean room, free wifi, loan of net book, great rates, super friendly and helpful staff. Hop Inn definitely made our first time trip to Hong Kong memorable. Love it! Thank you Hop Inn for the great hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “very cozy, but no heating, cold at night”
Reviews.Author: Babanakov
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, small, but cozy & nice & very clean rooms (we lived in superior "owl" room). Location in heart of tsim tsa tsui - no comments. Room was very cold at night (even for Russian people :)), no heating in room. Second blanket and hair dryer, from reception, were wary helpful.

Reviews.Title: “such a good find!!!”
Reviews.Author: ItsMazzy
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is possibly the greatest find for those on a budget. Our room was really celan, and even though it was small, there was just enough room to put our two large bags at the end of the bed. The bed was so comfortable and most of the time I got a good night's sleep. Except for when I unfortunately got an Ear Infection! The guys at the front desk were incredibly helpfull when this happened; writing down the address in chinese for the Queen Elizabeth Hospital and instructing us where to hail a cab. They were always helpfull when it came to directions, giving us addresses and lending us adaptors and what not. There is also free purified water and wifi available at all times which proved to be very handy. The hotel is located right in the heart off TST, just off Nathan Rd so it is in a perfect location with many attractions and shops nearby as well as the metro station. Also, the hotels map with instructions from the airport is really helpfull so be sure to use that. Would def stay here again if i am travelling on a budget :)

Reviews.Title: “Great find.... would def stay again”
Reviews.Author: kri5ty
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed here for 4 nights in december 2010.... and thought it was great We were on a budget as we are backpacking, before i came i looked at hostels, and looked at all of the ones in "the mansions" on Nathan road, i decided on the hop inn instead due to the good reviews on here, we werent sorry! (we even went to look at the mansions to check we made te correct decision... and certainly did!) Location- The hop inn has a great location, It is a 2 min walk to Nathan road, 5 min to Victoria harbour (for the night laser show), and 5 mins walk to the star ferry (for the ferry over to HK island) We printed the map off from the hotels website... this was very good and with the instructions and a map we picked up from the airport we found it with no problem. (from the airport get off the bus stop it says on the website, walk down peking street opposite the mansions, then the road the hostel is on is the road betwwen the addidas shop and fortress) The journey is very easy and is a 5 min walk with heavy backpacks... 2 mins without!! The hostel is also a 3 min walk to the metro station. Buy an octapus card from the aiport! It is great value and the transport systems are sooo easy to use! Facilities- We stayed in room two called "boom". Yes it was small as some of the reviews on here have said (but that is what to expect in hong kong unless you pay for one of the huge hotels!) There was a double bed (which is a little hard, but after a long day sight seeing you are so tired you just fall to sleep anyway!) And there is a cubicle in the room in which your private bathroom is, and there is a curtain which you pull around, behind the glass when you are in there. The shower was lovely and was hot!! There was also a TV in the room as well as air con. The hostel provided free water, where you can fill your bottles up, free wi fi, and also you can borrow things like laptops, adaptors etc. Overall i thought this hostel was a great find, and would def stay there again!! We did a few trips over in hong kong (Pink dolphins, the peak, ocean park, big budda) all were easy to get to, any questions just ask! One final thing.... visit the manchester united bar on the road next tot he hstel... even if you are not a fan, the coktails are amazing!!! Especially if Antonio is there, he made me one that only 2 places in the UK are serving at the moment, he goes around the world with his job!! And have plasma screen tvs in the urinals!! haha

Reviews.Title: “Clanging pipes! No sleep!”
Reviews.Author: slsLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as an alternative to the hotel I usually use which is on Hong Kong Island. I was warned that the rooms were small, but this was not my main problem. I went for a double and it was small. But what was worse was the fact that every time the guy in the next room had a drink, flushed the toilet or ran a tap, the plumbing and piping shuddered. And groaned. And clanged. It was like a funfair ride going through my room, only it was not fun. I think my neighbour had a waterworks problem because this happened all through the night. I don't know what he was doing in there. I got no sleep. When I went to find out what was going on, the guy at the desk said that he could hear nothing. I kept going back and saying it was noisy and he kept denying it. Eventually I rushed out of my room once while it was happening and dragged him in and he finally admitted that it was noisy, and said it was the plumbing. He said it was always like that. I lasted one night and then checked out, even though I had originally booked 4. I had to pay for all 4 up front, and they refused to refund my money. They did say that they would refund the money if they managed to fill the room, and gave me one night's money back. And then claimed that they could not fill the last 2 nights which I was not convinced by. I thought the price was good, and the location was great. The art in the rooms is nice and the desk people were friendly and helpful. It's a good concept. But I got no sleep and it drove me nuts. And I was not impressed by the denial of a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: jmemd
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days and 3 nights with my husband... glad we decided to book this place. Great location in the heart of TST in a relatively safe area. We saved so much on transportation bec the MTR is a few mins away, even sidetripped to Macau via the China Ferry Terminal (15min walk). Other places nearby, Harbour City, 1 Peking for Aqua Roma, Starbucks, 7-11, 1881 Heritage, etc. Staff was wonderful from the moment i inquired via email until we checked out. They are efficient, friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but CLEAN. They provided our own towels, shampoo and body wash. Cleaning lady came and cleaned the rooms everyday. Bathroom is also small but I loved the warm shower (strong pressure too). A/C was also very cool. There was free wifi and drinking water in the "lobby". Only downside was that the bed was hard and not so comfortable, But with all the good things about this hostel, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: rubeelima
Reviews.Content: This place is a gem. It is located right in the centre of TST and the rooms are very nicely decorated with you own private bathroom. There's free wifi too which is a bonus! Would definitely stay here again when I'm in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location, rooms are small, but if you're just looking for a sightseeing base are fine.”
Reviews.Author: Kelpygirl
Reviews.Content: Hostel is small with private rooms, located in an apartment block with entrance between 2 shops. 2nd floor means it can be a little bit noisy in the night, so take earplugs if you're a light sleeper. Rooms are basic with minimal furniture, just a bed, tv, shower, basin and toilet, but if you're intending spending most of the day out and about are fine, and location is excellent. Located 3 mins from Star Ferry, Tsim Sha Tsui MTR, airport A21 bus stop (HK$33). For taller guests, probably worth asking for a bed with a bit of toe room, but fine for shorties under 5ft 10. Staff are extremely friendly and helpful. If you're worried about missing your daily coffee, Starbucks is 2mins away and there's plenty of shopping opportunities nearby

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a weekend stopover”
Reviews.Author: gimpygoose
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hop Inn for three nights for a weekend stay in Hong Kong. The location is perfect and really close to the main shopping and nightlife areas in Tsim Sha Tsui and 5 minute walking distance from either the Star Ferry or Metro to go over to Hong Kong Island. The service is brilliant and all staff go out of their way to help you and offer advice of places to visit etc. You can also borrow a laptop, which was great when we needed to check-in to our flights. We stayed in a double room for two nights which is small but confortable - the air con is definitely needed in Hong Kong! I was suprised how quiet the room was at night. On the final night we were in the twin (bunk bed) room which we didn't like - the bed was very noisy and would creak whenever you rolled over at night! Overall, the hostel is very clean, friendly and great value.

Reviews.Title: “location”
Reviews.Author: lou_Dallas
Reviews.Content: With prior direction to the hotel (next to Addidas shop and accross from HMV store), we crossed the hotel entrance four times to finally realized Hop Inn's entrance is a little door, sandwiched between a Camera Shop and a Traditional Medicine shop. Entering the hallway gave me a little uncomfortable feeling as it is very small and worn out with old desk, security camera, water pipes and airducts... Not a very good first impression at all. Heading up second floor via the elevator, we can easily spot Hop Inn sign. We rang the bell and entered another tiny hotel loby. Wilson greeted us and gave us a speedy check in at 11:30AM. Had to fully paid for all 3 nights in advance though. We had room #4 for triple. This room also gave me an uneasy feeling with old fixtures, airducts, pipes and a window that could not be tightly shut which took in the cooking odor from the downstairs restaurant. What I like about Hop Inn is the location, services, free wifi, free water. I dont like the hard bed (I felt like sleeping on a box spring), the cooking odor, the noises that we could hear from outside street as well as our neighbor in room #2, the slamming door sounds... through out the night. The bathroom style with shower/toilet/sink combination is not my favorite either. I also dont like the toilet floor with some dark moldy spots and the cimented hallway that looks like we are in a haunted hotel. Bottom line is: I would not want to come back to Hop Inn (even for HKD650/nite ~85USD) and I would definitely not recommend my friends and family to come here. The last nite at Hongkong, we went to Rambler Oasis Hotel in Tsing Yi. It was heavenly nice. I had a good nite sleep, finally.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: DandMtravel
Reviews.Content: Hop Inn is a small, simple hostel/hotel in the heart of TST, 5 mins walking distance from star ferry terminal, the peninsular hotel, TST metro, great eateries and museums. The staff fall over themselves to be helpful. The rooms are small, practical and clean. The value is excellent. I cant say enough great things about this place. Get in here quick and book in!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for this location”
Reviews.Author: VickieB671
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms are small but if you don't have too much luggage you'll be very comfortable. We had quite a bit because we'd just come off a 14-day cruise so it was difficult getting around in a double room. We moved to a triple for our last two nights and were much more comfortable. Everyone working at the Hop Inn is extremely helpful. They are very conscientious that your stay is enjoyable and comfortable. Don't be put off by the entrance, the inn itself is very safe and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great things come in small packages.”
Reviews.Author: vtm
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small, but it is such a great location and relatively good price that overall it was a great place to stay. Right in the middle of the action in Hong Kong, Kowloon. The staff were great at keeping us busy, and arranging a taxi to the airport for an early morning flight. There is so much to see around Hong Kong, that you need to spend little time in the room anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: aikoko
Reviews.Content: This little hostel is a fantastic little place to stay and great value for money given the location. The staff were very friendly and helpful in directing us around the city, plus they honoured our booking which we made several months in advance (We also changed our plans on multiple times and they were quite accommodating as a result). Other pluses include the overall cleanliness, the showers are hot, TV with DVD player, nice artwork on the walls, comfortable bed, clean towels and linen, they tidy up the room each day, feels very safe, free (and fast) wifi, aircon works very well, generally it is quiet however in the morning you can just hear the traffic pass by. On the downside, the rooms are small! We stayed in the double room and the bed is actually a 1.5 double bed rather than a true double. There was only enough space to open our suitcase on the floor and that's about it really. We also moved to a triple room, and there was more room to swing a cat, and place our suitcase but if three people stayed there it would be a squeeze with the luggage. However, we just used the hostel as a place to sleep rather than a place to hang out (if so then I'd find another place to stay...but it is just a hostel and not a luxury hotel). As such it was perfect for us. There is no lounge room to sit and meet other travellers, but there's a nice little cafe next door on the same floor called the Peace cafe. A nice place to relax with a drink and play a board game after a long day of exploring the crazy city.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Hongkong, value for money”
Reviews.Author: RolandStamf
Reviews.Content: My first Inn experience, my room was small but not a problem, this is HongKong. It's clean, comfortable bed. Friendly staff, kind and helpful. Wifi worked and free. Great value place to stay in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “unprofessional”
Reviews.Author: unhappyAussie
Reviews.Content: made a booking for 3 adults for a triple room back in March which was confirmed by email, Correspondence went back and forth all good, then a couple of weeks ago i emailed to say i would only need 2 beds now as third adult was not coming Hop Inn then said they never had a booking from me but then contradicted them selves to say other people booked the room before me so i had no longer a booking with them, would of been great if i hadn't of correspondened before our trip on the 1st of nov..I would not be in business today if i ran my business like them.

Reviews.Title: “Best guest house ever”
Reviews.Author: tesyasblog
Reviews.Content: I have written a review before on hop inn hk, and now would like to share the link of the full review in my blog http://tesyas.blogspot.com/2010/05/review-on-hop-inn-hongkong.html Enjoy reading..

Reviews.Title: “Fab location and really friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Rhianx1
Reviews.Content: This place was lovely. Great location and the two hosts Simon and Wilson couldn't be more helpful. The rooms were small but I think its what can be expected in Hong Kong. It opens right onto one of the main streets and there's plenty of retaurants nearby. Only 5 mins walk to the star ferry too. DVD's to borrow to watch and Simon and Wilson were always on hand with a map or advice on where to go. It would have been good if there was a little chill out area as the place was literally on the 2nd floor of an apartment block off the main street with all the rooms off a main corridor, but I couldn't fault the service and friendliness of the staff. Plus Wifi was available and actually worked in all the rooms. For the price of it though it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good staff, but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Lizzipoo
Reviews.Content: I'm really confused about quite what to put in this review as I thought it was a good little hostel, but my partner did not like it. However, to be fair I think that any reservations he had about the Hop Inn are more about him wishing we had spent more money on somewhere more spacious rather than a criticism of the place. The staff all speak excellent English and could not be more helpful. The location could not be bettered - a five minute walk from the metro , Nathan Road and the Star Ferry. Free Wi-Fi in rooms. The rooms are all small which we were aware of having looked at the website and the reviews, but I guess we hadn't relaises exactly how small. We stayed here at the beginning and at the end of our trip and had a variety of rooms. If travelling on my own, I would have no hesitation in recommending Room 3, a single room, which seemed to have the same, if not more floor space than some of the double rooms and was also very quiet, haivng no window. We also stayed in room 9, with a bunk bed. This was very small for two and it was difficult to sleep as any movement on the top bunk shook the lower bunk. The bathroom was also smaller than some of the other room, such as room 2, which had a slightly larger bathroom, but a very small double bed - we ended up top to tailing. I would not hesitte to recommend the Hop Inn to some of my friends, but not to others - dependent on what they want and how they like to spend their time when on holiday - eg: we like to have a siesta, but such small rooms are not condusive to this.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: rickydmd888
Reviews.Content: We booked three nights in Hop Inn based solely on the reviews here in TripAdvisor. We were not disappointed. The room was indeed tiny (Room No 2), but we stayed in a similar cramped room in Kowloon Hotel previously and paid double the price there. The location is excellent. And the staff, especially Kit, were all too willing to help. They provide free hot & cold drinking water, DVDs (their rooms have TVs with built-in DVD players) and even lent me a laptop to use! Their free wi-fi works well.

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Razimatazi
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for one night and it is very much like home. Dont expect it or any place in HK to be roomy but they made use of the space well and the design of each room are artful and fun. As a plus, staff can speak english clearly and are very accomodating. They have free wifi and an area with all the tourist map and brochures you will need. For the budget price, great location and superb service, the place is great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Helpful English Speaking Staff”
Reviews.Author: fannz37
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hop Inn for 3 nights in their Like a Balloon room. It was a pleasant stay for my sister and I for our short stay in Hong Kong. We arrived after 12 midnight and the receptionist welcome us warmly, which was greatly appreciated after our flight was delayed and we alighted at the wrong bus stop. The internet connection worked well so we could skype home. The room was small but clean, shampoo, soap and towels were provided. The female receptionist who served us most of the time spoke good English and helped us with the directions. My only complains are that their pillows are too soft, making it uncomfortable for a side-sleeper and it is a little too noisy when rainwater splatter on the window.

Reviews.Title: “Budget & Quirky in Lively area”
Reviews.Author: Fee_Fighter786
Reviews.Content: All I look for in accommodation when I travel is something easy on the budget but also cute-and I'm not talking pink frilly cute - quirky/trendy/cool cute. Hop Inn, is a perfect example of this. There are 2 small rooms, I stayed in Lemon Drop~typical asian style minimalist room. Low bed, Shower/Bathroom in one/Airconditioning/TV. Sheets are not spotless, but were fresh and washed. Towels/Shampoo/Body Wash available. Staff allowed me use of their laptop , which was really helpful considering World Cup broadcasts in HK were only on cable tv. Given directions are pretty good. Shops around the accommodation. Same Building - Cafe / Foot Massage Parlor /Halaal Indian Restaurant. Street - 7/11(general), Watsons (chemist/toiletries), HMV(music). Other Tips Coming out of the accommodation: Turn right Starbucks: Straight down 2/3 blocks East Tsim Sha Tsui Station - Exit L : Walk straight from accommodation until first traffic and turn right(you'll see a store called Fiona's Prince, cross the street and walk to your right -the station is really close. Harbor Terminal and Avenue of the Stars - walk straight, until you get to Salisbury road, and turn right -about ten minutes -you might have to go under and up again to get to the side where the harbor is

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: DoraemonSingapore
Reviews.Content: Good location in TST. Clean hostel. Nice and friendly owners. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the heart of HK”
Reviews.Author: wynne1
Reviews.Content: We just ended a five day stay at the very small, nine room Hop Inn and couldn't have been happier. We were looking for a budget hostel-type hotel which pretty much sums up what Hop Inn is. As far as hostels go in HK, it has to be near the top. The rooms are tiny, but all hotel rooms in HK are small, maybe just not this small. For two people with carry-ons, our room worked out well. The beds were pretty firm but we were able to sleep fine. There is free Wi-Fi and a TV in the room. Our TV worked well but there were only one or two English stations but you're not in your room much so that isn't much of an issue. They do have a DVD libary that you can use. The place was clean and has a funky, industrial design type feel about it. The bathrooms are also small but functional and the showers are great. The greatest assests of Hop Inn are the people who man the desk and its location. Wilson, Simon and Kit are very helpful in their recommendations and we were always very satisfied .Because the hostel is so small, it is almost like having your own personal concierge. You also can't beat the location for convenience and easy access to transport, shopping and the harbour as well as other sites. We'ed stay there again, for sure. Give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place”
Reviews.Author: David-Scotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights with my girlfriend. Like everywhere in HK, the rooms are on the smaller side - this did not cause much of a problem, there was room enough for a couple of open cases and the two of us. Wetroom was small but functional. TV in the room did not pick up a signal but there was a decent DVD library in reception and there is loads to do in HK anyway so no reason to spend much time in the room. Hop Inn is very centrally located - that is a great selling point - maybe 5/10 mins walk from Star Ferry and less than 5 from Nathan Road. Some noises from street outside but nothing that stopped me from sleeping - the bed was pretty comfy. Special mention should be made of Simon - he was very friendly and welcoming and happy to recommend restaurants etc, which was very helpful as the best spots can be hidden several floors up. Use of the free laptop and wifi was also good. There is no safe in room but one in reception that the staff can put things in for you. Not all staff have access so if you are needing something out then arrange in advance to make sure you can get it - I needed photo ID one day but could not get it for a bit. Good that only a few staff have access to the safe as it shows they are taking security seriously but worth bearing in mind if you need urgent access.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Roostourer
Reviews.Content: As others have said rooms are on the very small size but its in a good location: Less than 5mins to Star Ferry etc. Once past the surly security person for the building its a great base for a short stay in Hong Kong. Its all really clean beds are a little on the firm side but comfy and the staff are really helpful. Bathroom was a little tired but just superficial stuff. Would stop here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hostel in Kowloon madness!”
Reviews.Author: xiribita
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hop Inn 3 nights. Two in a double room and one in a single. I have stayed in different hostels in Kowloon, and this is by far the best I stayed! The rooms are really small, like everywere in this area, but clean and confortable. The host, Wilson, is a really nice guy, that takes time to speak to you and give suggestions. It's safe and the location could not be more perfect. For the price-quality balance I would recommend this place to everyone on a small budget. And take time to visit the Hong Kong Museum of History (100 Chatham Road South). It's one of the best museums I've been, really informative.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Service~ with reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: cclt
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 days this Apr. Staffs were very nice and helpful for our request. Though the room is not very large , it is clean and comfortable. it's near tsimshatsui station, very convenient~

Reviews.Title: “Genuine good service at a very affordable price”
Reviews.Author: Mse2201
Reviews.Content: Having travelled the world and stayed in many 5 star hotels and resorts you come to expect good service where ever you stay, in most of these places however you pay for the service and hotel staff provide the service because they have to. At the Hop Inn you feel that the staff really enjoy what they are doing, all of them are friendly, courteous and extremely help full. The rooms are on the small side, but clean and well laid out and nicely decorated. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, new, good value with helpful and friendly hostel owners!”
Reviews.Author: walkearth
Reviews.Content: This place is in a very convenient location, just steps away from TST MTR station. The rooms are very small, but that is to be expected for this price and location. Highly recommended for budget travellers who values affordability and convenience! For people unfamiliar with Hongkong, do take a look at the photo of their entrance provided on their website to help you locate the place.

Reviews.Title: “tiny little place”
Reviews.Author: mandalay1971
Reviews.Content: Good location and Wilson is a nice guy. The only thing is I'm just not use to tiny single rooms.Not recommended for claustrophobics.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Trendy, Cozy, and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: KandMTravels
Reviews.Content: This chic little hostel offers a great location, friendly staff, and about 9 cozy rooms. The inn is only a few months old so you get a fresh feel to your stay. It's near the metro and conveniently located for exploring all corners of Hong Kong. The quaint little café next door made a good complement to our stay. The staff is super friendly, and that scored major points with us as well. I recommend this inn for your next short stay in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: NomadTripping
Reviews.Content: When I saw the website of Hop Inn, what made me decide to book my stay here is the room design and the reviews. I was not disappointed. My stay in Hop Inn was great. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The room was spacious enough. The bathroom was a bit small but that was fine. I traveled with 2 friends and their kid, but they stayed in another hotel. Their kid however preferred to stay in my room. I guess because of the design of the room and because my room was more spacious. She could play around and climb up and down the bed. Clean towels were provided and the room was cleaned every day. Another thing I appreciated is you can borrow a laptop from them and this comes without charge. The location was great. It was very accessible since it’s near the TST MTR Station and since it’s in TST you have the shopping district around you and you’re just a few blocks away from the Avenue of Stars, The Clock Tower and Harbour City where you can watch the Symphony of Lights.

Reviews.Title: “This place is highly recommended. Nicely...”
Reviews.Author: Sabbatradler
Reviews.Content: This place is highly recommended. Nicely decorated, clean and comfortable rooms with Wifi. The staff is so friendly and helpful. Very good base to explore Hongkong!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT FOR ME! NEAR TO EVERYTHING!”
Reviews.Author: MARIAOLI
Reviews.Content: i was in hk for the New year eve, and everything was full, i found only 1 night in Hopin, after that i tried to find another clean, cheap and with a good location and was impossible.. simon was very helpful and he found for me another place.. i was staying in a single room, small, but very clean, no window, but for me was perfect. the rooms also are very modern, with original paints in the wall

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Value for Your Money”
Reviews.Author: Babygemski
Reviews.Content: I found Hop Inn via a travel forum, it had great feedback from other travelers. I had a smooth transaction with them via email and skype IM. Their booking procedure is straight forward. They spoke very good English so booking was not a problem and they entertained our questions about payment procedure and options. The rooms are very clean and is just perfect for a traveler. We got the one big bed and one twin bed and is just right for us (me and my friend). The bathroom is cute and clean. It had glass panels but you have a shower curtain that you can just pull when you are using the bathroom. It is accessible to local eateries, restaurants. In fact there is one right next to the Hanyee Building where Hop Inn is and a couple more along the street. The Wellcome supermarket is only a few steps ayway. The MTR is about 2 minutes walk. The WIFI is good and free!

Reviews.Title: “Cool place, great location”
Reviews.Author: goodbaduglychina
Reviews.Content: Want something better than the grimy Chungking mansions but don't want to sell a kidney to afford a good hotel? Hop Inn sits right in the middle. Not a hotel as such, but a really nice shiny new upmarket hostel is a good description. Check out their website, the pictures don't lie. Rooms are, as is expected in HK, small, but they're well designed, and there is definitely enough room for a stay of a few days. Beds are comfy, showers are hot, sheets and towels are clean (well, everything is clean). Staff are great, can speak really good English, and are very helpful. The location is great too, right in the middle of places to eat, drink and shop, and only a couple of minutes walk to Nathan Road and the nearest MTR station. Considering the location, the room was really quiet at night, so was able to get a great night's sleep. In total we stayed 4 nights, and were very happy. Would definitely stay here again in the future. Slightly difficult to find, but is accessible from a *small doorway* directly opposite HMV on Hankow Road. Look in the doorway, look for a *small* sign on the wall just inside the doorway... Take the stairs/lift to the 2nd floor and you're there. I've only given it 4/5 for value... but that's just because I hate spending money :-)

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Jewel”
Reviews.Author: flaphoto
Reviews.Content: Hop Inn opened last month and is an amazing place to stay. Although small (like most rooms in Hong Kong), the rooms are very clean, well-appointed and decorated uniquely. Each room also has an LCD TV and DVD player and they offer a wide selection of DVDs to borrow. Simon and Wilson are incredible hosts who directed us to many great tourist destinations and restaurants. Definitely try Spring Deer for their Peking Duck. The location in TST (Kowloon) is perfect for access to the ferries and MTR system. I am looking forward to my next visit to Hong Kong and chance to stay at Hop Inn.
